website_summaries.verdict: Affordable, easy-on compression socks designed for use on swollen legs and varicose veins,
pros: Unlike some other products, these are suitable for people with thicker legs
Some pregnant women have found them very helpful
cons: A few complaints that the socks left red marks on the legs

customer_reviews.title: Gives Natural support
customer_reviews.text: My Doctor prescribed the use 20-30 mmHg compression stocking(s) to control swelling of my right leg due to a dvt & my left due to diabetes. I have spent a small fortune while trying to find the right one for me, and with 'Physix Gear Sport Compression Socks, I have. They fit snugly without binding at the top leaving deep red welts like most. Remember to buy the right size for you, and you'll feel comfortably secure all day while wearing these socks.
customer_reviews.author: LionBill

customer_reviews.title: Good quality compression sock
customer_reviews.text: These socks are overall great! Got them to use towards the end of my pregnancy when my feet started swelling. One improvement that I think could be made would be to have extra tightening panels around the arch of the foot to help with compression, as right now the bulk of compression comes from the tight panels from above the ankle up to the calf. Maybe for other people that doesn’t matter so much, but I tried another pair of compression socks that actually had that panel and prefer them over these because of that. Good quality sock though, still happy with my purchase and they definitely help!
customer_reviews.author: Arianna C.

customer_reviews.title: Prenatal Dream
customer_reviews.text: Highly recommended. I am currently 8 months pregnant and wear these beauties every single day. I could only afford one pair on our budget, but I come home from work, take them off, wash them, and hang them to dry for the next day. I never knew how painful the swelling in my legs and feet could be until recently, and these socks were a complete game changer. I stand for over 9 hours a day at work, so I can't begin to explain how badly my legs and feet ached. I have a picture of what my feet looked like with(right) and without using the socks(left). The difference is tremendous!!
customer_reviews.author: Olivia Stockdell

customer_reviews.title: These Comression Socks are too Expensive!
customer_reviews.text: The Compression Socks functioned as expected, but, for the money, consumers can get four times as many pairs from another seller. By Physix Gear's advertisement, I was lead to believe that I was purchasing (2) pairs of comression socks for the money I was paying. I only received (1) pair of compression socks. I will not be purchasing any more items from Physix Gear.
customer_reviews.author: Cisne Grande

customer_reviews.title: Pain reducer/comfortable support
customer_reviews.text: I originally bought this product for support when doing my morning run on my treadmill and to help with varicose veins. They have provided an added benefit however. I have recurring bursitis below my right knee that is quite painful and often swells. I have a very active life and cannot afford to be off my feet for the amount of time it takes to ease the pain and I loathe having to take ibuprofen too often. I started wearing these socks and the pain and swelling all but disappear! No more pain and seldom do I need ibuprofen! Additionally, customer service is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: kylencody

customer_reviews.title: There's a Break In Period
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product, the Stamina and competitor brand the copper toe. They, the stamina need time to break them in, but once they do, it's a superb product. It's easy to get them on, a bit more difficult to get off an end of day sweaty foot. But the Stamina holds up nicely, no tearing, no holes, and best of all they're not quitters. The copper toe, sold at Wally World, tear easy, the heel breaks out, they're very difficult to put on and even more difficult to pull off. I'd would recommend not purchasing the copper toe/heel for any reason. That said, I'm very happy with the overall performance of the Stamina product.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Eyer

customer_reviews.title: Solid Sock
customer_reviews.text: I was somewhat skeptical of this compression sock. I had hurt my knee at work and suffered a very deep bruise to one of my knees which caused swelling in my lower leg. Compression sock bought through workmans comp was around 50 dollars. Can't afford to buy multiple socks at that price. Physix Gear sock has proven to be just the cure I needed. Will be buying more for sure. I can work up to 12 hours somedays and this sock has proven to be very comfortable to wear too. Recommended if you are in need of a cheaper alternative but will not surrender performance.
customer_reviews.author: R. M. SilkeyTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Great for Traveling
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my long flights. I have larger calves and they fit great. When putting on be careful not to pull too much sock beyond. It will bunch up and pinch the back of your knee if you pull too much up. Did this once and learned to pull the sock up evenly. NEVER had a problem again. It was my first time wearing compression socks. They are great for traveling on long flights and when doing lots of walking. I love them would purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: VartLiv

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I started using these for running and obstacle course races. They work great! Even providing comfort to my calf while it was injured. I use these with the same brand of knee sleeve and after acl/meniscus surgery they are both great. The only thing is they dont stop me from getting blisters or losing toe nails during long distance running but other than that I love them!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: Hated this brand! Bought the correct size but were so uncomfortable and way too expensive for one pair. I ended up buying another brand on Amazon for a lot more affordable, way more comfortable and also came as an 8 pack and works perfectly for me as I use for POTS and poor circulation.
customer_reviews.author: amy

customer_reviews.title: I like these Physix Gear compression socks - so far, so good
customer_reviews.text: I am new to the world of compression socks. My ankle is 9-1/2 and my calf is 15in. One brand I bought used medium (15-20 mm which I found I needed two hands to put on and take off) and it was very snug not very tight and ultimately comfortable and were clearly great quality (costs 3x as much). This brand, Physix Gear compression socks, I decided to use a large size (20-30 mm) and, since they are not as tight, found them to be quite comfortable to put on and take off. Good Quality, nice look to it and great for the gym.
customer_reviews.author: joe crayo

customer_reviews.title: Love!!
customer_reviews.text: You guys I love these!!! Im a runner and for the past year I have been suffering from shin splint pain not during my 5 mile runs but right after so I decided to buy a couple of these and give it a try!! I started to wear a pair during my runs and a pair to sleep man did this make a huge difference!!! The swelling has gone down and I feel amazing!!! I really do recommend these for runners!!!
customer_reviews.author: jose

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, good support
customer_reviews.text: I got these as my doc asked me to begin wearing compression socks. I hadn't really noticed my feet and ankles swelling so much, but after wearing these I can see and feel the difference. They are high quality and fit well (I have small calfs so after about half a day the socks begin slipping at the top, which I think working out my calves some (not something I've paid attention to) will help that out). Anyway, I'm pleased with the purchase. I ordered the blue heels but home there is just all black which would work for more formal occasions.
customer_reviews.author: Hazard

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable socks
customer_reviews.text: Very fast service and good product. These socks are not as tight as some compression socks, but they still feel like they are doing the job. Interestingly, both my husband and I wear the same size; so I bought one pair to see how we'd both like them; and once we try them out on a long flight, we'll probably buy several more pair. I have purchased another pair from another company and plan to compare the two. However, in wearing both of them around the house for a day, these socks were more comfortable than the other pair, so i think we'll be back!
customer_reviews.author: Marilyn C.

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and useful
customer_reviews.text: Great feeling socks. Worn and washed three times with little to no wear. Comfortable top is also perfect height. The compression has helped me throughout the day including long periods of desk work, standing for long periods as in cleaning, and working out. Having more energy through a day has really helped to be productive through the day. I have four other types. These are the most comfortable while doing the job. I plan to order more and would highly recommend them especially to anyone with larger calf muscles
customer_reviews.author: wunderpea

customer_reviews.title: Hasn't lasted for even 6 months
customer_reviews.text: Is a great sock, good compression and comfort but have only used 6 months and a hole has developed in heel. Appears that the entire area around where the brown heal is attached to the sock is pulling away. Will get a sock that is all one piece next time
customer_reviews.author: Chris Baisley

customer_reviews.title: These are not compression socks
customer_reviews.text: No compression in these socks. I have been a nurse over 30 years. I know what compression stockings are. I have squeezed many a legs into the tight compressive socks. These are simply knee high socks. No compression existed at al when I tried them on. They were not even stretchy so I could not even fantasize that a smaller pair would be tighter. I do not recommend these unless you just need some expensive knee high socks.
customer_reviews.author: reliable consumer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect socks for pregnancy
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pregnancy and I've had vein issues since the beginning. By now, during my third trimester, things have gotten worse. These socks have helped me out a lot! I put them first thing in the morning before getting out of bed (it is hard to put them on with the belly) and just take them off if I wear shorts or dresses. They do not look "good" on you, but they do take the pain and swelling away, so I rather have that than suffer throughout the whole day.
customer_reviews.author: rossc264

customer_reviews.title: but my husband liked his. I would give 3-4 stars since my ...
customer_reviews.text: WARNING! $6.68 was deducted from my return!! I don't understand why that is not clear when placing an order! I am going to contest it as a matter of principle. I found the compression to be insufficient and not in alignment with the shape of my legs - and the top band to be a little too constricting, but my husband liked his. I would give 3-4 stars since my husband liked them if not for the ridiculous return fee.
customer_reviews.author: JR

customer_reviews.title: Sizing Chart No Accurate
customer_reviews.text: I was very excited to receive my first pair of compression socks. They came next day which was very impressive by Amazon. I used your sizing chart however they are too large and are too long. They come up past my knees. I know it would be unsafe to roll them over to fit at my calf. As per the vendor's notes, I contacted Adam directly to resolve this issue. That was a week ago. I am yet to receive a response. I am very dissatisfied with the customer service. I was hoping for a resolution. This pair of socks are useless to me.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Barberio

customer_reviews.title: better than I expected
customer_reviews.text: I got these for my son who stands on concrete floors for 12 hour shifts in steel toe boots. I was not sure if they would work, plus the price seemed high. He put these on and off to work he went. 12 hours later,... he tells me he feels great. His legs don't hurt, they don't feel tired, or are they swelled. He is a true believer in compression socks now. And me, I realize they are well worth anything I paid to make his day a little better.
customer_reviews.author: 2 plus mom

customer_reviews.title: Do not help varicose veins.
customer_reviews.text: I was hopeful- these are half the price of the cotton compression stocking that DO work. My leg w/ varicose veins were suddenly horribly itchy- and as I itched, a bad rash developed. Then the pain. I was making plans to have varicose vein surgery- then I realized I wore these two days in a row. 1 day of my previous danish cotton compression socks and the itching was fading- 3 days and the rash and pain were gone. I just purchased 4 pairs of the danish cotton ones. I have been wearing them for years and had no idea how helpful and required they were until I tried these!
customer_reviews.author: S. Davis

customer_reviews.title: Hole in sock after one wear
customer_reviews.text: Loved the product, but only wore them once, than on second time putting them on I got a hole in them. Returning the sock after less than a week. See picture.
customer_reviews.author: A

customer_reviews.title: One pair of socks, not three pairs
customer_reviews.text: I was disappointed to receive this product and to find only one pair of socks. I saw the photo of three socks and was comparison shopping against other compression socks sold in 3-packs, so somehow was under the impression that this was also sold as three pairs. I have worn the socks once around the house and once to the gym and like them quite a bit, but might have chosen a different product if I realized these were effectively three times more expensive than I had expected. Hopefully this review saves someone else from the same mistake, but they are nice socks either way.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Wide calves are legit
customer_reviews.text: I normally have wide calves and while pregnant things get decidedly worse. So getting normal compression socks on my legs is an ordeal and super painful. I ordered these as a last ditch effort to fit in some normal shoes the last two weeks of my pregnancy. I pretty much assumed this was going to be wasted money. I was pleasantly surprised the wide calves were great! Easy to get on (who am I kidding my husband put them on!), but definitely did the job in keeping my swelling down as much as possible. I didn’t realize they made wide calf options for compression socks. Highly recommended. Quality of the socks were great!
customer_reviews.author: Anabelle

customer_reviews.title: Excellent run recovery socks.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair and I truly love them. I work up to 17 hours straight and they help keep swelling away. They are also helpful for run recoveries. They have helped tremendously with plantar fasciitis and shin splints. The band at the top is snug to keep them up all day but not uncomfortably tight like some other brands. I’ll be wearing them on my long flight to Scotland soon. I give the four stars only because the size I need are slightly long in the toes. If the toe was not too long, I could use them for running but the way they are now it would rub and cause blisters.
customer_reviews.author: Debra Googins

customer_reviews.title: Supportive, Protective, and Make Me Run Faster, and Jump Higher :)
customer_reviews.text: When I saw all the cool kids wearing knees socks when running I was reminded of my days in Boy Scouts wearing knees socks while hiking. Knee socks were practical with shorts because they kept my calves from getting scratched up on the trail. These days I trail run and my calves were getting scratched. I had reduced my trail runs this summer because of the prevalence of deer ticks so prevalent in New England woodlands. I was spraying with Deet for every run. Knee socks seemed like a good compromise and this pair feels great. They are super supportive on my nearly 60-year-old legs.
customer_reviews.author: P. B. Panagore

customer_reviews.title: Quality but Uncomfortable (to me)
customer_reviews.text: Wore them on a plane trip that took me 10 hours from door to door (1 stop) and by the time it was over I couldn’t wait to take them off. That was the first use, however, so obviously I might could adjust with more usage, they just seem a tad stiff. If they are a little more pliable after they’re washed, then I would give them five stars. Have since bought a pair of Ames and they are more comfortable, day one.
customer_reviews.author: Gail F. Adamson

customer_reviews.title: They are comfy but develop holes fast
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoyed these socks but after only a couple of months they developed holes on the heels on both sides. I tried contacting their customer service but they never got back with me on the issue. For the price of these socks, one would think that they would last longer but unfortunely a cheap pair of wal mart socks lasted longer than these. Ill update my review if customer service ever reaches out to me.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathon

customer_reviews.title: CAUTION: You only get 1 pair
customer_reviews.text: I know this is totally on me, but I was a little surprised when the package showed up with only one pair of socks in it. I was a little rushed as I was shopping, and made the assumption I was getting 3 pairs of socks, not just one. Ah well. The socks look good! Nice bright colors (I got the green ones). The material feels a little thin though, and I feel like I'd like a little more compression. I got a L/XL, which was the recommended size for me. I would probably buy more if the were 1/3 the price.
customer_reviews.author: Durelle Leaman

customer_reviews.title: A Very Fine Choice for Compression Socks
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for compression socks to help with a health issue of very low blood pressure. I've taken measures to combat this problem such as 'Slow Burn" exercises, good dietary food choices, heart supplements and the socks were to compensate for daily sitting practice. The socks felt great the first time I put them on. It reminded me to get up regularly and move around. My legs feel pure pleasure walking in the socks. No noticeable improvement in B/P yet, but I need to give that time. I made a wise choice buying the Physic Gear Compression socks. They are handsome and reasonably priced.
customer_reviews.author: Mystery Buff

customer_reviews.title: They're falling apart :(
customer_reviews.text: Good support but the top seams are falling apart after 3 days. Maybe I got a defective pair. Can't seem to be able to connect with the seller to see if I can exchange them.
customer_reviews.author: Avinator

customer_reviews.title: Nice try
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because I thought they would help my rheumatoid arthritis. My right ankle/foot swells up with fluid periodically and while not painful, it is unsightly. Pros: compression is great, not too thick, easy to put on, comfortable to wear. Cons: didn't do anything about my type of swelling,the length of the socks are too long for my short legs. The top of the socks cut into the back of my knees so I had to slide them down a bit, which obviously took away from the comfort.
customer_reviews.author: J. Banks

customer_reviews.title: Quality initially good but dont last.
customer_reviews.text: Good for the first few uses but then rip developed. I use the proper gloves to put them on and hand wash. Mostly disappointed with longevity. Quality initially good but dont last.
customer_reviews.author: Photios Vassilyadi

customer_reviews.title: Not for women with larger calves/legs
customer_reviews.text: Being 8 months pregnant, my feet and legs are swelling. Numerous people told me to purchase compression socks. I think the quality and look of this product is great. However, having larger calves/legs, I was nervous they would cut off my circulation, (and I was correct). I am thinking about trying the men’s socks to see if the calf runs larger.
customer_reviews.author: SCUD

customer_reviews.title: Good company, but way too tight
customer_reviews.text: The quality of these socks and the customer support from this company is why I gave it 4 stars. I found them much too tight to be able to wear for any amount of time. They were also difficult to even get on (and I followed their directions for how to put them on). I purchased them for long plane flights, but there is no way I cold have put them on in the airport bathroom or on the plane and they were MUCH too tight to wear for any extended period of time (at least for me). Back to the drawing board.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 2 different sizes
customer_reviews.text: I’m not even sure how to even rate this review seeing as they sent me TWO different sizes, I purchased one pair btw. When I first put the left sock on I thought I wow these really do compress and then I put the right and was like wth because 1. They were much easier to put on & 2.they went up a little more towards my knee rather than the left which stayed below. Definitely returning & hoping I get BOTH sizes (same) this time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cannot say enough good things!
customer_reviews.text: I bought 3 pairs of these (2 in blue and 1 in grey) and I cannot state how comfortable they are! I currently am fighting GVHD due to Leukemia and the prednisone they have me on increases swelling in my legs. Well, these stylish, comfortable, and incredibly supportive compression socks are just the things to control swelling. I also have no dorsa flex in my left foot due to a 10 day coma in 2016 I was in. Since then I have trouble walking as my left does not pick up proper when walking and sometimes my toes will catch the ground and send me falling. Well, these actually improve my gait and make walking a bit easier.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Cured my post Knee replacement swollen foot
customer_reviews.text: Eight weeks after a full knee replacement my foot was still so swollen I had trouble putting on shoes. The first day wearing these socks produced improvement. I only wear them during the day. After one week I am able to see veins and details in the foot the swelling had hidden. There is a little puffiness remaining behind the smaller toes but it too is diminishing. I am able to wear a normal sock of the top so no one knows it is on. It feels like a nice snug hug. They are not to difficult to pull tight on the foot and around the heal and up the leg.
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: Quality socks, durable after many washes
customer_reviews.text: These compression socks are great. I’ve worn them on transatlantic flights, while working a long shift at the hospital, and when recovering from a strenuous leg workout. They’ve held up well to multiple washes. I just toss them in with my other laundry and they do fine. Normal wash, dry on medium. Recently, my girlfriend has been stealing them because they help with the swelling in her leg/ankle due to a chronic issue. So I have them to her and bought another pair for myself. Would recommend for any of these purposes.
customer_reviews.author: TechSavvyStudent

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: I like this socks a lot, I just wear them all morning for about 8 hours and they doesn't bother me at all, well I'm size 10 of shoes and 15 In calves if it helps you out the L/XL size fits great for me. Material looks and feels great in the skin.
customer_reviews.author: Jehú Hernández Morón

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: The socks felt great during a nice run but after washing the socks once, I noticed that there is an area on one of the socks that has frayed and a whole has formed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: AMAZINGGGGGG!!!
customer_reviews.text: I am seriously in love. I bought these while half asleep and in some serious pain. I was pretty upset with myself when I noticed I purchased $20 socks, but I decided to give them a chance. These are amazing. I got off work 3 1/2 hours early, and these were in the mailbox when I got home. I very quickly removed my socks and work shoes and put these on. Oh my goodness.. they are DEFINITELY worth every penny I bought and I will be buying a few more pairs. Amazing. They’re just right enough to where they alleviate pain but don’t cause it. Thanks so much for helping my poor, tired legs and feet. These are so amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Odessa Lillian

customer_reviews.title: If your feet or calfs are achy or swell up during day you need these socks!
customer_reviews.text: Ordered 3 pairs , had foot surgery and the swelling from working felt like if you poked my leg it would explode. Wore these socks 2 days , feet and calfs feel the best they have in months . Will have to order more .
customer_reviews.author: Oldaudio grandpa (David)

customer_reviews.title: Just OK - not great, not terrible
customer_reviews.text: I have high blood pressure, so just to be safe I wore these on our 10 hour flights to and from the UK. To be perfectly honest, by hour 8 of wearing these I was uncomfortable and the tops were digging into my legs. I didn't have any blood clots, obviously, but I'm not going to recommend these to anyone who is sensitive to tight hems or seams. I literally peeled these off in the airport bathrooms as soon as we landed, they were digging into my thighs so badly. So if you want to avoid blood clots, these should do the trick. But I think they might be better for shorter wearing periods than long international flights.
customer_reviews.author: Niesje

customer_reviews.title: Got a run the very first day of wear
customer_reviews.text: Item ran in the heel my first day of wear. I wrote a question to seller and never heard back :/ On a positive note, they were comfortable. I'd like to say I got a defect, but I don't want to go they the process of returning, reordering.
customer_reviews.author: Hunter

customer_reviews.title: Compression Hose are Great!!!
customer_reviews.text: The compression hose are as described in the description of the product. The size was perfect. I have nightly calf and ankle cramps that get me up several times a night. Since I received and started wearing my compression hose I have not had a single muscle cramps in my lower legs! I religiously wore compression for years when I was working in the hospital as a Nurse. When I retired from pounding the floor I quit wearing compression hose. When I saw your ad I decided to give them a try and have not been disappointed with your product or decision to go back into compression hose for my leg health!!!
customer_reviews.author: Sharon L. Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Worked perfectly
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for a mud run I was getting ready to do. I trained in them leading up to the run, and then wore them for the actual run. These worked great for keeping my calves fresh and protected, and helped me make it to the finish line. I have done runs in the past, and have come up limp and tight a few times, but I had no issues or problems for the entire ten miles. I sadly had to retire them after the run, as they were filthy and not worth the effort to launder, but they are affordable enough that I will revisit for future mud runs!
customer_reviews.author: Bobby D

customer_reviews.title: Works great  for Tall people like myself
customer_reviews.text: I'm '6"5 size 12.5, these sock work great they are plenty long to cover my calf. Putting them on is not bad if turn the top half to the heel wrong size out, put them on like a footie and them pull them up. I bought these on March 28th, 2 pair, and I switch them out daily. They aren't holding up well compared to Wigwam or Bridgedale socks but there not the same thing. These are almost like heavy women's hose, they pick and get runs in them. and now are not staying up all day, have to pull them 2 or 3 times a day now. Will probably by them again because I haven't found a better option.
customer_reviews.author: TDM

customer_reviews.title: Do Not Honor Money Back
customer_reviews.text: I bought 3 of Amazon's most highly rated compression socks. Out of the 3 these were my least favorite. They are a bit itchy and feel like they provide the least amount of compression. Not to mention the other 2 brands were actually cheaper. I reached out to Sarah from the company's customer service. She suggested making sure I wash them. I told her it still didn't make that much of a difference and I was not happy with the socks. She never honored the money back refund for not loving the socks. My personal preference for comfort, quality, and compression is to go with SB Soxs. Be warned this company DOES NOT honor their money back guarantee.
customer_reviews.author: Jason D

customer_reviews.title: Good for Arthritis!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these compression socks to help with my arthritis in my right ankle. Wearing compression socks takes the pain level from a 10 to about a 3. I live 15 miles from the ocean so when it rains or storms (barometric pressure) I'm pretty much limping without compression socks. I've been wear compression socks off and on for the past 3 years. Compression socks with 20 to 30 firmness helps me the best. I found this brand to be soft and really comfortable. I like that the calf band wasn't overly tight. This brand was really easy to put on. I will definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Jane Austen

customer_reviews.title: Not great for me
customer_reviews.text: This product wasn't my favorite. I was gonna send them back but shipping cost so much that it wasn't going to be worth it. So I'll see if someone I know likes them better. They are very tight around the very top. The brand stitching is not stretchy and keeps the top from stretching like the fabric should. It causes it to be uncomfortable. And the socks constricted my a lot around the top of my ankles. The fabric bunches and is really tight there. I tried the readjust them multiple times and could never fix this.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Towry

customer_reviews.title: Too large
customer_reviews.text: Compression socks frequently run large. These are no exception though they are not the worst about running large either. For some reason, when it comes to compression socks, it appears the definition of a medium aligns with a men's US size 12 to 15. These seem to run around a men's US size 10.5 to 13. I do not know why compression socks are all over the map with respect to their definition of a medium, and when they do advertise a range of shoe sizes, add at least 1 shoe size if not 2.
customer_reviews.author: RocketCityChas

customer_reviews.title: Physix Gear Stamina compression socks are great for lower compression needs
customer_reviews.text: I use this product for foot and ankle swelling I now have post-op from gastro-esophageal cancer surgery. I bought several different products the same day on Amazon, based on user reviews. I found, as did a reviewer, that this product, Physix Gear Stamina compression socks, is less constricting, and lower thickness, than some other products. I compared this item to another item, and confirmed that when my compression needs are less, or I wish to have less compression on my feet and ankles, this product serves my needs very well. I can wear it for a longer period of time before needing to remove it.
customer_reviews.author: Dano

customer_reviews.title: Like them but have issues
customer_reviews.text: I own several different brands of compression socks and skin-feel-wise i think i like these the most. I like the socks but i'm disappointed in the stitch quality, especially on and around the cuff area. I've only worn these a handful of times and already the threads around the cuff are loose and fraying/coming off. I've taken care to only wash them on delicate and the times I've worn them have been mostly while flying, so they haven't been under much stress either. I've got another pair in green and they too aren't doing as great as i'd hoped. The overall feel of both pairs is looser now than i'd normally attribute to very light wear.
customer_reviews.author: Sleeping Overlord

customer_reviews.title: Not enough compression :(
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these in hopes they would help my sore legs/feet at work. I am a nurse and typically work 12 hour shifts with lots of standing and walking. These compression socks offered me some relief, but the fit isn't quite right for me. I'm about 5'2"-5'3" and 115 lbs. The stockings come up over my knee (which causes lots of pinching). I also don't feel that the ankle portion fits as well as previous socks I've owned, which means I'm not getting as much of a benefit from the compression. I probably wouldn't order again as I would like a better fit with higher compression!
customer_reviews.author: Barnbine

customer_reviews.title: Very Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: First, I actually bought a size that was a little to big for me. I was able to wear them and even with that minor issue they sock felt good. Second, I thought I was going to get a 3 pack of socks but after reading descriptions more closely I realized that it was only a single pair. Another minor issue that was once again my fault. All in all I will be buying these socks again not just because I like them, but because I have to wear them often. Good quality, good comfort, good reviews and reasonable price. Thats all I need.
customer_reviews.author: Tiran

customer_reviews.title: Top of stocking too tight- dies not allow for swelling.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my son. His calves are an issue when it comes to any kind of compression stockings. I did read reviews. However, I have to return the stockings because they were too tight at top. So tight that it caused marks/indentation on his leg. There is not enough give at the top. They would cause more harm than good for him. They are really nice compression stockings but the top is just too tight for anyone with upper calves that are even a little above average
customer_reviews.author: Javelina

customer_reviews.title: No bird-legs here! These sox fit as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: These socks fit! I have suffered from leg edema for several years during that time I have been able to go from a 15-20mmhg to a 20-30 mmhg compression. However, I prefer the over-the calf style that goes up to the knee. Most 20-30 compression socks on come in a Large size. Physix Gear compression sock come in a XXL size as well. No more painful compression ring in my legs when I take my socks off at night. I really appreciate that Physix Gear recognizes that not all of us out here have legs like a Flamingo!
customer_reviews.author: Richard Barnes

customer_reviews.title: Everyday use
customer_reviews.text: Not just travel, or working out, I’ve been wearing them every day. I love that there is lots of toe room without compression. My legs are chunky, and I almost subtracted a star for the top band being a bit tight. But that’s my own dang fault—I need to lose weight! What I did was stretch out the top band and it fit better. I’ve worn support hose and these fit better than most. I would consider buying another pair to alternate pairs.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonCustomer

customer_reviews.title: They definitely work
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these because I'm going to be on my feet all day. When I wear them, I can definitely tell that they do work as far as reducing foot and leg stress. They recommend that you hand wash them but you can machine wash them. My suggestion is if you do machine wash them make sure you put them inside something so that they don't snag on anything else because you pay enough for them you don't want to risk damage. I would recommend these to anybody.
customer_reviews.author: angie9277

customer_reviews.title: Pregnancy Must-Have
customer_reviews.text: I'm 7 months pregnant and these socks are life savers... I put them on in the morning and wear them all day at work and my ankles don't swell at all. Without them, even with my feet propped up, they would swell to the size of softballs. My legs feel better and because I'm not limping around the office my hips feel better, this has made pregnancy so much better, I was really struggling there for a while! Thank you compression socks!! So I have wide calves and size 9.5 feet... And long calves... The large fit perfectly!
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Made a huge comfort difference for long  flights
customer_reviews.text: Got mine before a two week trip to Ireland and the U.K. I normally have my feet swell on long flights, but these socks kept that from happening. They even washed out well in a sink and dried overnight, ready for hiking around on the next day - many, many days in a row. They worked equally well going through the washer at home, hanging to dry in our laundry room. I plan to use them on domestic flights back home, too. Very pleased with their performance - my feet and legs are so happy!
customer_reviews.author: mamafirebird

customer_reviews.title: These are fine, but not a great value
customer_reviews.text: I have several brands of compression socks, these are fine... a lot like the other brands you see here on Amazon. I do feel like the presentation on Amazon is a bit misleading (and by other questions/reviews I'm not alone) in that they clearly show three images of the sock/socks, but you are only buying one pair. With getting one pair versus three, the value would naturally decrease. I'll pay X for three average pair of compression socks, but when paying the same for one pair, the overall value decreases. So, in the end, I overpaid for an average pair of compression socks. There are better values and they are not hard to find here.
customer_reviews.author: btip

customer_reviews.title: They fit!
customer_reviews.text: Haven't been able to buy compression hose locally for years. Not only were mine old, but not enough compression. So I searched Amazon for some new ones. I purchased two kinds. I sent the other brand back because they were too short and acted like a tourniquet, causing swelling instead of relieving it. These were so comfortable and actually knee-high, that I bought five more pairs in various colors. The compression is the correct amount for my needs, the toes aren't crowded, and they are comfortable. And the seller has been in contact with me to make certain that I am pleased with the purchase. Thanks, Adam!
customer_reviews.author: old_broad

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable and easy to care for
customer_reviews.text: I've tried other compression socks and quit after experiencing the difficulty of putting them on and taking them off. These have excellent elasticity that also combines with the compression factor, that makes the process a bit more practical. I've been wearing them since I got them.! I do use a device to help put them on, and very easy to use with these socks. Outstanding product and will probably be ordering more. Also like that they can be machine washable.
customer_reviews.author: GDL

customer_reviews.title: Bottom line: They work!
customer_reviews.text: Wore these around the house for a couple of days and could definitely feel the difference in my 66 year old legs. My main reason for purchasing was cycling, average trips between 30 and 40 miles. This is where they excel. Muscle fatigue and leg pain during and after my rides are almost non existent. Should have done this years ago. Getting a second pair to wear around the house. Was initially skeptical about the advertised results but now I'm convinced. This brand is very soft and comfortable. No issues riding in summer temps. They fit perfectly after exchanging for one size up. KEEP AWAY FROM VELCRO! Hand wash and flat dry. Happy Trails!
customer_reviews.author: Learner

customer_reviews.title: Put them on and took them right back off
customer_reviews.text: I'm pretty sure I purchased a pair of these like a year or so ago and they weren't this bad? I'm a nurse so I'm always looking for good compression. These ain't it sis. I purchased them according to the listed measurement guidelines...they're painfully too small/tight. There's not enough give/elastic at the top. They cut off right below my knee and painfully dig into my calves. Compression socks are meant to regulate circulation, not cut it completely off.
customer_reviews.author: amaurer88

customer_reviews.title: Performance gains are noticeable for sure
customer_reviews.text: I bought these as an experiment working out and long runs. I switch back and forth between these and normal socks every other day. Performance gains and less fatigue over the span of a 2 hour work out are noticeable. They fit as the should, I have a Size 13 foot, larger calf’s, and the XL size is perfect. They come to just below the knee. I would not recommend for travel unless you have medium or small calf’s, after 4-6 hours wearing them the compression level gets annoying. I have multiple pairs now, have tried other brands etc. and these are my favorite pair. They are also very durable, light weight and breathable.
customer_reviews.author: torsten palm

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely rescued me from a bad airline flight
customer_reviews.text: I already had one pair of these and had used them on previous flights but this last flight I had left them in a bag that I checked through. Needless to say, the 9 hour flight, plus all the hiking in the airports left me with some issues. I went back to using the socks when I got home and then ordered another pair right away. They gave me amazing and quick relief for circulation and muscle support until the swelling went down. I regret that I didn't have the foresight to use them ahead of time but at least they have proven their value to help me recover. Buy them! Use them and don't travel without them!
customer_reviews.author: White Crow

customer_reviews.title: False advertising
customer_reviews.text: Not overly impressed with the product and they only sell you one for the same price everyone else sells you two or three. Product isn't awful but nowhere does it say for how many you are purchasing but it shows you three in three pic. And they are only ok. They come to the middle of your knee if you are average height and you have to turn them down one inch which isn't good for them. I wouldn't buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not the same
customer_reviews.text: Bought two pair, and the blue pair is not stitched the same size as the pink. One calf is much tighter along the top seam, and so its harder to roll up the calf. Once up, it cuts harder as well, and doesn't stretch nearly the same as the other leg. I do not have the same issue with the pink pair, so its definitely a quality control issue. Compression wise, these are not as strong as other brands I own at the same compression level. They do, however, look like the day I purchased them, whereas the other brands are showing wear, even though they have been worn the same number of times.
customer_reviews.author: L. Moor

customer_reviews.title: Great for Vericose Veins
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these socks due to bad varicose veins in my left leg. I wore these socks for quite some time and had minimal issues. The only problem I found is that they are not long enough to stay tight around the top part and so they would slide down. This is a common problem. Overall the material was fantastic, elastic, and kept shape after multiple uses. These are great socks for anyone that doesn't want to wear the standard white compression stockings. I would buy these again if they were a bit longer. These socks would become annoying working out or running, because you would have to stop to correct the issue with pulling them back up.
customer_reviews.author: Skylar Hartnett

customer_reviews.title: great quality but sized poorly
customer_reviews.text: I was really excited for these socks because the quality felt great! Unfortunately the S/M is too big for my foot and too long for my calf. Being too big on my foot didn't bother me but too long on my calf was a bummer because if I wore it over my knee they would roll down and if I folded them below my knee it would be too tight and when I "scrunched" them below my leg per customer service recommendation it was not comfortable either because I had lines of where I bunched it when removing. I am just under 5'4 and wear a 7.5 sneaker - this brand is not good for my size.
customer_reviews.author: Rob Waxman

customer_reviews.title: Hot and Itchy
customer_reviews.text: I have a pair of compression socks from another manufacturer but the color is solid black so I was looking for something with style and comfort.. I liked the colors amd shape I seen online and ordered 3 pair.I was disappointed when the shape and style was a little different but figured I'd give them a try. Here's my review Very warm and in the sun these would heat up so much I thought I was having a chemical burn. Not that breathable compared to others As soon as I removed the socks I was very itchy for an hour or so. Once I washed my legs the itch would go away
customer_reviews.author: Jaybird 78

customer_reviews.title: WORKS
customer_reviews.text: I've had a hard time finding compression socks that don't completely cut off my circulation, but finally found a pair. I am taking a high blood pressure medicine that causes fluid to build up in my ankles. I sit at the computer working for hours my feet and ankles didn't swell. The socks were actually comfortable as well. My legs are short So normally compression socks squeeze way too tight. These were comfortable but still did their job and I have room to move my toes. Overall very happy with the product. Only thing I change is the size to long for me goes up past my knees
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: These socks work!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these for my husband who has cancer and has severe swelling in his legs, ankles, and feet. I had all ready purchased an expensive pair of thigh high compression stockings that didn’t help much and fell down constantly and wanted to try something else. He has only worn these a few days and they have made a considerable difference, especially in his feet and ankles. He used to say that his ankles hurt because they were so swollen and now there’s very little swelling. At a fraction of the price of the first pair I purchased, I can easily buy a couple more pairs.
customer_reviews.author: September MorneTop Contributor: Coloring

customer_reviews.title: These did not work for me.
customer_reviews.text: I don’t know about other people, but these did not work for me. I’m 9 months pregnant with very uncomfortable swollen feet, so I bought these to reduce the swelling. I can say that they weren’t uncomfortable. However, when I took off the socks my feet were more swollen than when I first put them on. I’m pretty disappointed because I really wanted these to work. They might work for others, but that was my experience with them.
customer_reviews.author: Ibuythings

customer_reviews.title: These are the best Compression socks I ever had.
customer_reviews.text: These are great. I am 72year Vietnam vet. They did not kill me yet.I brought home some bad Cancers ,I will shut up Any way I have varicose veins Not bad but there .My left knee is bone to bone. I Hope to have that fixed soon.My leg's hurt from morning to night.My left leg had a weak pulse so had to get a clean out,I have bought a lot of compression sock's. Not a good grade. Also I have restless leg syndrome. I love these socks. My leg syndrome. Seems to bee a lot better. Very well made sock's . And I will tell my brothers about these. I s 5ure will buy 5 more pair. Thank You.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Crnkovich

customer_reviews.title: Better than most popular brands!
customer_reviews.text: I have been buying from Adidas, Nike, and so on for many year with the average sock price for about $30. Some are good, but shrink after a few washing and drying. Some just torn after a few wear. I don’t see that issue with this sock although it lose compression a little bit after about 10 uses. But hey, I am fine with paying 50 cents per 1 wear for this quality. The material doesn’t feel as comfortable as Vitalsox brand from Italy, but I am satisfied with paying about $10 per pair. I am 21 and use these socks during soccer training. I use Copper Compression brand on match days.
customer_reviews.author: Mr.Win

customer_reviews.title: Remediation needed for this kind of compression socks.
customer_reviews.text: The compression socks kept the buyer from getting a blood clot. He followed his doctors advice to wear them for 30days after hip surgery, and to remove them one hour each day. The patient followed directions. The problem the purchaser had was that the socks at the toes he would push the socks about two inches forward; after a few minutes the socks moved back so close to the toes it was quite uncomfortable. . This was constantly done to the socks. We hope the manufacturer can remediate this problem. But for circulation it served its purpose. It protected the patient, he had no blood clots.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for tall people with size 13-14
customer_reviews.text: These socks are literally, fantastic. The material they're made of is so comfortable against your feet, they feel great putting them on and wearing them all day. I ordered 6 pair in a variety of colors and I won't be wearing anything else. I'm over 6' 3" and still have to roll down the top as they would end up on the middle of my knees. I wear a size 13 and there's room for a size 14. I haven't worn a pair twice so I don't know if they shrink, but I'll let you know if they do!! So far, great product!!
customer_reviews.author: RJGOLD

customer_reviews.title: Great BUT.
customer_reviews.text: My feet get SO!!!! Sweaty. I'm 5'4 130lbs size 8.5 -9 shoe, Fit body type. I bought the L/XL. The foot part is too long. Its snug but the sock slides around and gets loose and sometimes folds on itself and its annoying to step on but if I wear tight enough shoes it's not so bad. The calf part fits very snuggly. Comfortably. I've never owned compression socks so I didn't know what to expect but my legs felt good after a long day at work. So I really like em. Idk if I'd get a smaller size cuz the calf part fits nicely. I just cant get over how sweaty these socks made my feet.
customer_reviews.author: ShilohLauren

customer_reviews.title: Not for wider calves and knees
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like these. I purchased size L/XL for my 19" calves and 8-8.5 sized woman's feet. I could get them on and they did fit over my calves and pulled up to my knees. Unfortunately, the band at the top ended up cutting into my leg just under the knee and became so uncomfortable, I had to take them off within an hour. I would recommend for those in the lower or middle end of the size range given and/or who don't have larger legs all the way up, especially around the knee area. I think they would have worked well for my needs if the band hadn't been so tight.
customer_reviews.author: dd

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable for first time user.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the x/xl size, 2 pairs, and they fit my legs fine. I wear a size 9 shoe and my calves measure close to 16". It took me some time to put them on the first time, but had no problems the second time. My legs feel refreshed and comfortable from morning till night. Regular socks, athletic or anklets cause my feet or legs to itch where they fit. Not a single problem with these compression socks. I do have a very minor issue with the toe seam. I will have to see what it's like after a long hike. If all continues well I will order more pairs of these socks.
customer_reviews.author: Harry Settle

customer_reviews.title: Best socks I've ever purchased and GREAT customer relations.
customer_reviews.text: I had veins removed from my legs decades ago and need tall compression socks to keep my ankles from swelling. These are the best, most supportive, and comfortable socks I have ever purchased. I have tried dozens of other socks and brands and I have never had socks as good as these. Another VERY important thing is their customer service, it could not be better. I had questions and a small issue and they very quickly responded the very hour I emailed them. They kept in touch as soon as I reached out. I rate the product and the customer service response 100%. You can't go wrong with this family owned business.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Trendy comfy compression socks
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these for swollen legs during pregnancy, but I have bought other pairs in the past for travel. These are by far my favorite. The previous compression socks I had purchased (from a local store) were more expensive, shapeless and made from strange fabric. These are sewing to fit like regular socks, made of nice fabric and I love the colored heel design. Pay attention to their sizing chart before purchasing as you may be a size you aren’t expecting. I’m a small to medium build woman and purchased the L/XL socks as recommended, even though I thought it seemed big. They were the perfect fit and I know I wouldn’t have been able to get into something smaller.
customer_reviews.author: BlueHyena

customer_reviews.title: Quality product!
customer_reviews.text: This is my first go round wearing compression socks, so I don't have any comparisons to make. Socks seem to be of decent quality. They definitely help with the circulation. I have, what seems like restless leg syndrome. I've been wearing these for about 3 days. I also, based on a friend's suggestion, been using my inversion table right before bed. Not sure, but seems to be helping. The combination of the socks and elevating my feet might do the trick. We'll see. All in all, these socks are well made. I bought 3 pair snd might buy a few more.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas P. Ament

customer_reviews.title: More comfortable and cheaper than Mojo
customer_reviews.text: Follow the size chart and you won't go wrong. I'm on my feet all day and have trouble with retention and swelling. Started using these around the clock and have seen a huge difference. The price seems to fluctuate frequently, get them while the price is lower for sure. These are more comfortable thank the mojo and fit more accurately.
customer_reviews.author: Kara

customer_reviews.title: Great for travel
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to use before a 14 hour flight. I have never used compression socks before but it was suggested I get some. I bought these because they were the least expensive and looked nice. These worked great! On my trip I made the mistake of taking the socks off right before landing. My ankles swelled slightly. On the return trip I wore the socks for several hours after landing and this time I had no problems. My husband also had a pair and they worked great for him also. They are very tall (almost up to my knee) so I had to slightly scrunch them down to be comfortable while sitting. Otherwise I would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: M.E.S.

customer_reviews.title: Great Socks
customer_reviews.text: I've worked 12 hour days on concrete for the last decade or so. Always moving, almost never sitting down. The last year my legs have gotten to aching. No complaints, I mean, I'm 53 after all. A friend suggested these and it has changed everything. My legs would be achy and swollen after a day's work and now, with these socks, not a trace of swelling and my legs are not achy. They aren't as difficult to put on as medical-grade TED hose, but they have quite a lot of support. Certainly worth the price and definitely would buy again. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Sock opening too small.
customer_reviews.text: I usually wear a Large size in other brands, so I ordered the L/XL, that was a mistake. These socks have such a small opening, I couldn't get them past my ankle without cutting the top part of the sock to make a bigger opening, then they slid right on. They still kind of work. I don't know if I got defective ones, or if these are made for children rather than adults. The quality is questionable at best, the material isn't a typical compression sock, it's more a cheap thick cotton than standard compression spandex. I wouldn't recommend them, not worth it.
customer_reviews.author: J. StacyB

customer_reviews.title: Nurse
customer_reviews.text: I wear these for all my shifts. I’m a nurse on 13 hour night shifts. I’ve worn these socks every shift, except once last week because I’ve been rotating two pairs and finally got caught out with laundry. Just bought this third pair so it doesn’t happen again. The only shift that my feet and legs hurt: the one that I wore regular socks. They are very thin, but it hasn’t bothered me. I wear Croc Nerias with them. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: The System is Down

customer_reviews.title: Size is important, one size fits most is not the greatest idea
customer_reviews.text: Nice looking sock that is designed to fit a myriad of feet sizes. Unfortunately, this sizing scheme does not address proper fit up the leg. Shorter legs require rolling over the sock top just a bit, which creates pressure/tightness. I am concerned about durability as I have already seem elastic threads easily pull loose from the top area (calf) of the sock. I will update this review when I get through a few more washing and wear cycles.
customer_reviews.author: Steven R.

customer_reviews.title: Comfort and support
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to say a word or two about Physix Gear Sport Compression Socks. For the price, you won't find any socks I know of that offer as much support and compression as these. And they are sporty looking socks too! Store bought compression socks don't offer much compression, frankly, and it gets looser from there. I have used expensive compression socks which do offer some more compression than these, but they are 3x the price. I find that Physix Gear Sport Compression Socks are exactly what the doctor ordered.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel M. Kaplan

customer_reviews.title: Not calf friendly
customer_reviews.text: I was really disappointed with these. I have a large foot, size 10-11, but I had never considered it wouldn't even think about going over my ankle or up my calf. The foot portion fit, a little snug, but hey it's compression wear I expect that. The fact that I couldn't get it up any further than just above my ankle is another story. I do not have massive legs or ankles, and it really just was not working out for me. Because I foolishly washed it assuming that it would fit everything since it was long enough for my foot, I am not out the money they cost. Lesson learned.
customer_reviews.author: E. Simpson

customer_reviews.title: Updated review
customer_reviews.text: After wearing these socks for a awhile they are great. On 3/9/2020 I wore them to my doctors appointment and ask her opinion. She did a couple of checks and said she liked what she seen and that these socks are suitable for my needs. Doctor like the weave and graduated compression. When a doctor is impressed with your socks that tells you WOW great product. I can not top that recommendation only to say best socks I have found yet and I will be ordering several more pairs. I highly recommend this seller and these super socks DMD
customer_reviews.author: dmd

customer_reviews.title: Best & most durable
customer_reviews.text: Chubby Hubby is on his feet too much and has a lot of problems because of it. Compression socks really help him & I’ve bought a variety of brands to try and help him. (because you know how whiny men can be). This is BY FAR the best brand he’s worn and is the only ones he hasn’t shredded, so I had to buy him some more to replace other brands. (I think he secretly plays tug-of-war with the demon dogs using his underwear and socks, as I don’t know how people possibly destroy their stuff like this!)
customer_reviews.author: Honest opinion

customer_reviews.title: I have ankles!?
customer_reviews.text: I originally bought these socks because I run 4 miles a day. My legs were constantly sore and my recovery time was getting longer. I now wear these while I run and my legs feel great. I have also always had thick ankles. Im 130 pounds but my ankles are the same width as my calves. When I took off these socks for the first time I was surprised to see well defined ankles!!! Granted the swelling comes back within a few hours, but it is such a nice change
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Townshend

customer_reviews.title: Work great and reasonably cute too!
customer_reviews.text: I am pregnant in Eastern NC summer, a PT on my feet all day, so my feet had started to get hugely puffy. Finally decided to buy some compression socks and they work great! A few hours with these on and my feet look almost normal again! Amazing! I’ll admit I only even wear them in the evenings, because crop pants are apparently the only style of pants they make for women now and compression socks and ankle pants are just a nope LOL. But just with evening wear they help so much! I find them comfortable too.
customer_reviews.author: Bama

product_meta.title: Physix Gear Sport Compression Socks for Men & Women 20-30 mmHg - Athletic Fit
feature_bullets: STYLE AND CONFIDENCE ON YOUR LEGS – Finally! A Durable Compression Sock designed to last, without compromising quality or Comfort. Double stitched Fabric your legs will thank you. Feel the immediate Comfort and remarkable design of your new Stamina Long Sock Tights. The Perfect Work, Cycling, or Ski Socks. Quality stitched & Easy to get on even though they are a compression sock! They Wash well without losing compression keeping all the Excellent vascular toning benefits.

BECAUSE PUSHING YOURSELF THAT EXTRA MILE MATTERS! Get your blood circulating in style! Great for relief of varicose veins, Calf Compression or other leg swelling issues. Use it every day night or both. Prevent Blood clots after surgery & Fits well unlike other Dr. prescribed Stiff varieties. The compression & support is perfectly located on Heel Foot Calves and the toe area wont squeeze your aching toe joints. Instant comfort support. Moisture wicking properties rapidly air dry in a few hours.

TAKE YOUR GAME TO THE NEXT LEVEL – Comfortable material and careful construction. No stitches in places where they'll rub or rip together. Stay put Cuffs Soothing feeling at the bottom and sides of foot with no pinching seen with lesser quality socks without ankle support. Fall in love with your new Stamina socks easy to pull on. and they breath! Use in extremely hot weather crossfit through mud water wall/crawl/rope climbs and half marathons. Perfect for extreme races and long runs!

GRAB CONTROL OF YOUR WELLBEING IN STYLE – An Excellent compression hose very durable with a fashionable look and variety colors available. Washable designed with Quality Lycra Fabric built for durability. Customers agree the comfort is amazing. Use them on a plane during that 9 hr flights or during that 6 mile walk Your durable 20 - 30 mmHg sleeves work with your routine. Feel the shock absorption effect instantly that really helps reduce fatigue and swelling in your lower leg.

GET READY. TO BECOME A RAVING FAN! – We cut no corner in our product and will cut no corners in our support of you! You are making a very intelligent decision doing business with our company. We know you're a big deal and we'll only provide you with the finest product and service around or your MONEY BACK! Add your Stamina Compression Socks to your Cart and experience the Physix Gear Sport customer experience phenomenon! Add to cart now to begin the amazing journey!
